message.content:
Step 1: Identify the relevant items.  
• From the balance sheet, “Total Current Assets” are given at the beginning and end of the period:  
 – Beginning Current Assets = 8,000,000.00  
 – Ending Current Assets = 9,122,854.19  

Step 2: Calculate the average current assets using the formula:  
 Average Current Assets = (Beginning + Ending) ÷ 2  
  = (8,000,000.00 + 9,122,854.19) ÷ 2  
  = 17,122,854.19 ÷ 2  
  = 8,561,427.095  

Step 3: Identify the revenue from the income statement.  
• Total Revenue = 791,992.51  

Step 4: Calculate the Current Assets Turnover Ratio using the formula:  
 Current Assets Turnover Ratio = Total Revenue ÷ Average Current Assets  
 = 791,992.51 ÷ 8,561,427.095  
 ≈ 0.0925  

Step 5: Rounding the result (if desired, to two decimal places, it is approximately 0.09).

Thus, the answer is:

{
  "solution": {"Current Assets Turnover Ratio": "0.09"}
}
